english: to enjoy; to receive; to offer (in sacrifice)

etymology.description: Pictogram: an ancestral shrine; see also 亯 and 亨; unrelated to 郭.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts an ancestral shrine or altar, evoking the act of presenting offerings and receiving blessings. By extension it came to mean enjoying or receiving benefits, and in ritual contexts, making offerings in sacrifice.

examples.chinese: 他一生勤劳，晚年终于享清福(他一生勤勞，晚年終於享清福)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yīshēng qínláo, wǎnnián zhōngyú xiǎng qīngfú.
examples.english: He worked hard all his life and finally enjoyed a peaceful old age.

examples.chinese: 公社丰收时，村民设祭以享祖先(公社豐收時，村民設祭以享祖先)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngshè fēngshōu shí, cūnmín shè jì yǐ xiǎng zǔxiān.
examples.english: At harvest time, the villagers set up rites to offer to the ancestors.

examples.chinese: 所有公民都享有受教育的权利(所有公民都享有受教育的權利)。
examples.pinyin: Suǒyǒu gōngmín dōu xiǎngyǒu shòu jiàoyù de quánlì.
examples.english: All citizens enjoy the right to an education.
